text: Location of Levoča District in the Prešov Region Torysky Greek Catholic Church Torysky is a village and municipality in Levoča District in the Prešov Region of central-eastern Slovakia. ==History== In historical records the village was first mentioned in 1284. Here was born the Greek-Catholic Bishop of Mukacheve Ivan Bradach (1732–1772). ==Geography== The municipality lies at an altitude of 810 metres and covers an area of 6.987 km². It has a population of about 390 people. ==External links== *http://www.statistics.sk/mosmis/eng/run.html Category:Villages and municipalities in Levoča District
title: Torysky
